channel.title: Ite, Im back as a freshmen again: Need help
channel.description:
Today my mom gave me credit card for myself and I was wondering if I could learn to make websites... Only because I wanna start a company for website designing, yeh...
So? Anyone tutor me or somethen plz? Im extremely new to this lawl...

item.title: Ite, Im back as a freshmen again: Need help
item.dc:creator: @Jay_Laze .Jay Laze
item.description:
@Jay_Laze wrote:

Lol… I made design earlier but couldn’t display it rofl =.=.

I only got learn HTML, css ( and some other web developement skills) atm, then Im on my way to a business. I might Start Ebaying cuz it don’t really matter atm for me, im only 14 years old rofl. Mom got me prepaid credit card with 50 bucks on it…

Read full topic
item.source: Ite, Im back as a freshmen again: Need help

item.title: Ite, Im back as a freshmen again: Need help
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:15, topic:148746”][quote author=OnlyOneRule link=topic=203964.msg1800345#msg1800345 date=1191543020]
Um XHTML is just simplified HTML… Rather than having to use capitals such as:

You can do:

Altohugh i can’t see the point in the , or tags. i don’t find it all that much easier.

And ‘XHTML strict’ was the most pointless thing ever.
[/quote]
you are completely wrong.
html allows for anything:

<hTmL>
<HEAD>
<title>foo</TITLE>
</HeAd>
<body bgColor=#333 link="348342">
<ul>
<li>
<li>
</ul>

etc.
whereas in XHTML, you HAVE to use lowercase tags, tags like have to end with /, attribute values must be wrapped in ".
people are usually like “OMFG XHTML OWNS!!!”, but this is questionable, as most xhtml pages aren’t valid xml, and usually parsed as regular html, even though it really is html AND xml.
xhtml 2 won’t be compatible with xhtml 1.1

also, major browsers (IE, FF, Opera) have all pushed W3C to continue with HTML (version 5 in this case), rather than XHTML[/quote]

Try using your code in IE 3.

Read full topic
item.source: Ite, Im back as a freshmen again: Need help

item.title: Ite, Im back as a freshmen again: Need help
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“OnlyOneRule, post:14, topic:148746”]Um XHTML is just simplified HTML… Rather than having to use capitals such as:

You can do:

Altohugh i can’t see the point in the , or tags. i don’t find it all that much easier.

And ‘XHTML strict’ was the most pointless thing ever.[/quote]
you are completely wrong.
html allows for anything:

<hTmL>
<HEAD>
<title>foo</TITLE>
</HeAd>
<body bgColor=#333 link="348342">
<ul>
<li>
<li>
</ul>

etc.
whereas in XHTML, you HAVE to use lowercase tags, tags like have to end with /, attribute values must be wrapped in ".
people are usually like “OMFG XHTML OWNS!!!”, but this is questionable, as most xhtml pages aren’t valid xml, and usually parsed as regular html, even though it really is html AND xml.
xhtml 2 won’t be compatible with xhtml 1.1

also, major browsers (IE, FF, Opera) have all pushed W3C to continue with HTML (version 5 in this case), rather than XHTML

Read full topic

item.title: Ite, Im back as a freshmen again: Need help
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:7, topic:148746”][quote author=TestDummy link=topic=203964.msg1799067#msg1799067 date=1191479270]
I thought you had a credit card?
[/quote]

So? I’d rather spend nothing that like $500 on a stupid image editing program. Check demonoid or download the GIMP. Also, learn XHTML or XML, I like them much better.[/quote]
XHTML fails in all possible ways, learn regular HTML instead

Read full topic

item.source: Ite, Im back as a freshmen again: Need help

item.title: Ite, Im back as a freshmen again: Need help
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

Well, you can take two different starts.

WYSIWYG and the “notepad” approach. I myself started with and continue to use the second approach, the first one is using editors like DW and FP. Read the tutorial on w3schools and then from there just find a free host and do some trial and error. That is the best way IMO.

Read full topic
